ARABIC: وَيُطْعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسْكِينًا وَيَتِيمًا وَأَسِيرًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They give food, despite their love for it, to the poor and orphans and captives:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And feed the needy for the love of Him, and the orphans and the captives,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: those who, for the love of Him, feed the needy, and the orphan, and the captive,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They feed the destitute, orphans, and captives for the love of God, saying,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And out of His love, they give food to the needy, the orphan and the prisoner.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And they give food, inspite of their love for it, to the poor, the orphan and the captive,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And they give food out of love for Him to the poor and the orphan and the captive:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: they give food, for the love of Him, to the needy, the orphan, the captive:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And feed with food the needy wretch, the orphan and the prisoner, for love of Him,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: they give food, despite their love for it, to the poor and orphans and captives,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And they feed with food, for love of Him, the needy, and the orphan and the captive.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: For the love of Him, they feed the needy, the orphan and the prisoner,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And they feed, for the love of Allah, the indigent, the orphan, and the captive,-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And they give food, inspite of their love for it (or for the love of Him), to Miskin (poor), the orphan, and the captive,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: who give food, for the love of Him to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And they feed, for the love of Him, the poor, and the orphan, and the captive.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And they give food in spite of love for it to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [76:8] And they give food, despite [their] love of it, that is to say, [despite their love] of food and their craving for it, to the needy, the poor, and the orphan, who does not have a father, and the prisoner, meaning the one who has been rightly imprisoned.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And feed with food the needy wretch, the orphan) among the Muslims (and the prisoner) and the Muslim prisoner in the captivity of the idolaters; and it is also said: any kind of prisoner, (for love of Him) despite their desire for food and its scarcity,
